title: 106_s630
content: TRANSFER OF RESPONSIBILITY FOR OPERATION AND MAINTENANCE OF THE FLATHEAD IRRIGATION PROJECT, MONTANA. The purpose of this Act is to preserve and protect family farms and ranches in the Jocko Valley, Camas Valley, and Mission Valley, Montana, by transferring responsibility for the operation and maintenance of the Irrigation Division of the Flathead Irrigation Project. This transfer does not affect water rights negotiations or adjudications, including those of the tribe. Definitions in the Act include terms like "contract," "irrigation district," and "project." The Act aims to transfer responsibility for the operation of the Irrigation Division of the Flathead Irrigation Project to the irrigation district. The terms "project," "Secretary," and "Tribe" are defined in the Act. The Secretary is required to offer a contract to the irrigation district within a year for managing the project. The Act transfers operation of the Irrigation Division of the Flathead Irrigation Project to the irrigation district. The Secretary must offer a contract to the district for managing the project, including rights and powers. The contract must address trust responsibilities to the Tribe, maintain instream flows, and preserve fisheries. The Act transfers operation of the Irrigation Division of the Flathead Irrigation Project to the irrigation district. The district must fulfill responsibilities, maintain instream flows, and amend repayment contracts with the United States. The Act transfers operation of the Irrigation Division of the Flathead Irrigation Project to the irrigation district. The district must fulfill responsibilities, maintain instream flows, and amend repayment contracts with the United States. Additionally, the contract may be revoked if the district damages tribal trust assets. The contract allows the irrigation district to operate the project, with the presumption that it will protect tribal trust assets. Changes in operation are allowed unless the district refuses to comply with new information or decisions. The contract allows the irrigation district to operate the project and transfer ownership of equipment and supplies paid for with operation and maintenance funds. The Secretary must negotiate with the district to enter into a contract within one year of the enactment of the Act. The Secretary shall provide the irrigation district with an inventory list of supplies and equipment purchased with operation and maintenance funds. The contract does not transfer ownership of real property or water rights to the district. This Act does not impact water rights negotiations between the State of Montana, the United States, and the Tribe.
